alert.note: Alert for Southern Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 8:26PM MST until February 24 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches around the Brian Head area and Pine Valley Mountains, and 6 to 12 inches elsewhere. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Southern Mountains. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Occasional snow showers will continue through tonight. Snow will increase across the area again Thursday, becoming heavy across the Pine Valleys and around the Brian Head area.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx.
